structure.unit: Taxation Of Fuels Used In The Propulsion Of Aircraft

law.text: The supreme judicial or the superior court shall have jurisdiction to restrain the collection, upon any sale exempted by the constitution and laws of the United States, of the excise imposed by this chapter. The complaint shall be brought against the commissioner, whether the question of the collection of the excise is in the hands of the attorney general or pending before the appellate tax board or is still in the hands of the commissioner.
